Definition: In this task, you must modify the text given in the input to generate a paraphrased sentence. Your output sentence must retain the same meaning, but does not necessarily have to include all the details as the input text.

Positive Examples.input: sentence_B_original: A man is eating a bowl of cereal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Meaning of the output sentence is not changed, another sentence is derived from the original so this is correct.

Positive Examples.input: sentence_B_original: A dog pushes a boy into the water twice
Positive Examples.output: The dog is knocking a boy into the water
Positive Examples.explanation: The main purpose of the task is to push a boy into the water, this is achieved as the word knocking is used.

Negative Examples.input: sentence_B_original: The lady peeled the potatoe
Negative Examples.explanation: Here the first sentence says, "The lady peeled", while the second sentence says, "No lady peeled", so this is not correct.

Negative Examples.input: sentence_B_original: A dog chasing a ball
Negative Examples.output: There is no dog chasing a ball
Negative Examples.explanation: The first sentence says, "Dog is chasing a ball" but the second sentence says, "No dog is chasing a ball, so this has changed the meaning of the input sentence.
